selection_reasoning: Selected top performer (hexagonal lattice at 2.4390) as the clear leader. Included two other high performers (grid and SLSQP) for diversity in successful approaches. Added two-phase hybrid for its refinement potential, and the failed optimization approach which just needs better constraint handling. This gives us a mix of proven winners and fixable approaches to build upon in generation 1.

trial_selections.reasoning: Highest score of 2.4390, significantly better than others. Hexagonal lattice approach is theoretically strong and achieved excellent results.
Second best score of 2.1667 using grid-based approach. Uniform radius strategy is simple but effective, good baseline for mutations.
Tied for second with 2.1667 using SLSQP optimization. Different approach from grid-based, shows optimization methods can work well.
Score of 2.1559 using two-phase approach (heuristic + refinement). This hybrid strategy has potential for improvement by tuning both phases.
Optimization-based approach that failed due to boundary constraint. The approach is sound but needs better constraint handling - worth fixing.
